summary.para: Called by the registered application's handler to get current registration information.

param.name: pdwSyncMgrRegisterFlags
param.para: Returns registration flags from the enumeration that indicate events for which the handler is registered to be notified.

returns.para: This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following:

description.para: Call was successful, the handler is registered.
Call was not successful, the handler is not registered.

summary.para: Registers a handler with the synchronization manager when the handler has items to synchronize.

param.name: clsidHandler
param.para: The CLSID of the handler that should be registered to do synchronizations.

param.name: pwszDescription
param.para: Text identifying the handler. This parameter may be NULL.

returns.para: This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following:

summary.para: Removes a handler's class identifier (CLSID) from the registration. A handler should call this when it no longer has any items to synchronize.

param.name: clsidHandler
param.para: The CLSID of the handler that should be unregistered.

returns.para: This method supports the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_UNEXPECTED, and E_OUTOFMEMORY, as well as the following:

description.para: The handler was successfully removed from the registry with SyncMgr.

summary.para: Exposes methods so that an application can register with the synchronization manager. This can be achieved either through the ISyncMgrRegister interface or by registering directly in the registry.

remarks.para: The handler must be a standard OLE server. It must register the standard OLE keys for an InProc OLE server in addition to the SyncMgr key.
